Description: Painted limestone shabti with a black lappet-wig, a red carved face with a beard, crossed arms in relief, the body is covered in a black wash(worn), the legs are inscribed with four rows(partially surviving) of Hieroglyphs(now illegible) separated by red lines, the back is decorated with a representation of a red seed-bag.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore
